intro: Senecio gerrardii, commonly known as the desert groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Senecio gerrardii is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
